summary: In Chapter 19, a new carpenter immerses himself in the renovation of an old building, experiencing an inexplicable connection to its history. As he works, he finds a dusty journal belonging to a former resident, Jack, whose life story eerily mirrors his own. The entries shift from mundane to foreboding, hinting at a tragic fate tied to repeated cycles of suffering through generations. Intrigued, Caleb begins to explore the lives of previous inhabitants, uncovering haunting tales that parallel his own experiences. He feels driven to confront the echoes of the past, realizing he may be part of a larger legacy defined by choices made by those who came before him. Chasing clarity, Caleb starts writing letters to those lost in time, attempting to reclaim their voices and break the cycle—taking a step towards healing and connection.
